CONJUGATES: N/A (functions as an adverb or noun, no inflections)
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English giestrandæg, from giestran 'yester' (related to 'yesteryear') + dæg 'day'. Cognate with Old High German gestartag and Gothic gistradagis.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb: A word or phrase that modifies an adjective, verb, or other adverb, expressing a relation of place, time, circumstance, manner, cause, degree, etc.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I saw him yesterday at the supermarket.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我昨天在超市看到他了。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Yesterday was a very productive day.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 昨天是效率很高的一天。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things, or to name a particular one of these.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: The recent past; a former time or period.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: We shouldn't live in the glories of yesterday.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 我们不应活在往昔的辉煌中。
